p: The CT can be positive in the early phase, several days after the onset of the opening symptom (0–4 days). Over time, the CT findings change characteristically. In the progressive stage (5–8 days), the affected areas usually grow and sometimes thickened interlobular and intralobular lines appear inside the GGO. This combination pattern is called crazy paving. It is not characteristic for other viral pneumonias; hence, it can help the differential diagnosis [ 3].
